ARABIC: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا فُتِحَتْ يَأْجُوجُ وَمَأْجُوجُ وَهُم مِّن كُلِّ حَدَبٍ يَنسِلُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: When Yajuj and Majuj are let loose and rush down from every slope,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Until when the way is opened up for Gog and Magog and they press from every elevated place,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: until Gog and Magog are let loose, and begin swooping from every mound,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: until Gog and Magog are let loose to rush down from the hills.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Till the time when Yajuj and Majuj are released, and they will be flowing down from every height.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Until, when Ya'juj and Ma'juj (Gog and Magog people) are let loose, and they swoop down from every Hadab.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Even when Gog and Magog are let loose and they shall break forth from every elevated place.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: till, when Gog and Magog are unloosed, and they slide down out of every slope,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Until, when Gog and Magog are let loose, and they hasten out of every mound,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: but when Gog and Magog are let loose and swarm down from every hillside and they spread out, [leaping across every barrier of land and sea],
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Until when Ya'juj and Ma'juj are let out, and from every mound they are trickling down.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: until when Gog and Magog are let loose, and they race down from every slope,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Until the Gog and Magog (people) are let through (their barrier), and they swiftly swarm from every hill.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Until, when Ya'juj and Ma'juj (Gog and Magog) are let loose (from their barrier), and they swiftly swarm from every mound.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: till Gog and Magog are let loose and slide down out of every slope;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Until, when Gog and Magog are let loose, and they swarm down from every mound.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Until when [the dam of] Gog and Magog has been opened and they, from every elevation, descend
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:96]   Until (hattā, [a particle] expressing the end of the prohibition of their return) when Gog and Magog (read Ya’jūju wa-Ma’jūju or Yājūju wa-Mājūju, [these are] non-Arabic names of two tribes; there is an implicit genitive annexation before this clause, namely, the [gates of the] sadd, ‘the barrier’, [built] against them) are let loose (read futihat or futtihat) — and this will happen near the [time of the] Resurrection — and they slide down, they hasten, from every slope, [every] highland.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Until, when Gog and Magog are let loose) then they will emerge, (and they) i.e. Gog and Magog (hasten out of every mound) and elevated location.
